speaker: Bone Altar
lines: An altar ribbed with femurs waits under wax stalagmites.
Tallow murals show kings kneeling to farmers and farmers kneeling to nobody.
A book bound in funeral cloth hums when you do not look directly at it.
Three teeth sit in a saucer: milk, wisdom, and something else's.
A string of coins runs along the edge, cut so each can escape alone if needed.
You feel the weight of a promise you haven't made yet settle on your shoulders.
It fits better than your cloak.
Something asks for a word. It doesn't care which, as long as you keep it.

choices.text: Pledge to carry the names that have no mouths.
Break the saucer and scatter the teeth.
Take the cloth-bound book and leave.
